TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content:
thank you that did the trick!

guys was there another update to 0.24.1?

An aeodynamic version would be great for this. I miss having it on my spaceplanes.
Can we get a bit more container space inside the lander, to fit a full PRC?
This is the single greatest mod I've every seen, why isn't the IVA's of all the capsules like this?

Are there any incompatibilities present with this mod, KSP will not load with it installed.

It definitely is not a RAM issue as I have a significant amount of mods installed and removing a chunk of them does not help.

I am running 64bit.

Cheers,

Pete

Are there any incompatibilities present with this mod, KSP will not load with it installed.

Please post your output_log.txt. Also, a list of mods you have would be good as well as confirming you have installed it exactly as detailed in the OP. I suspect your problem may be RPM related as this is basically an elaborate part and RPM powers the whole screens and MFDs etc, but I'd need the output log to verify. Also, check on x86 as well - x64 is highly unstable anyway.

For reference, I also have a huge list of mods and have encountered no problems with ALCOR on 32bit.

Does for me works fine.

I love this.....keep going on the same track you on.

If you want a lander pod with .... glass displays and beautifully designed camera, internals, the external pod it self, then just download this with JSI.

LOVE IT.

If you do not like this mod then there is something wrong with ya.
I'm a bit unclear as to how one installs JSI. can someone explain it to me as if I were a dumb child.

You install it like any other mod. You place JSI in your gamedata folder and and thats it. You need to download RPM or Raster Prop Monitor. Now you don't install the folder titled RPM or Raster Prop Monitor you install the folder inside that which is titled JSI. I hope this helps.

Do you plan someday to make a capsule version of the ALCOR (and also compatible with SDHI) ?

Anyway, this mod is like.. DA BEST !!

Love this mod. My entire game now revolves around lots of IVA because of the pleasure of using the ALCOR capsule. Thx for all the hard work.

EDIT: One complaint though. The vanilla capsules now look ugly as sin in comparison. Squad really needs to do better if modders can do what you've done here.

Do you plan someday to make a capsule version of the ALCOR (and also compatible with SDHI) ?

Anyway, this mod is like.. DA BEST !!

I have shared these videos quite a few times since I have subscribed to this thread. It seems to be the most common request and in fact even I requested it when I first subscribed downloaded and played. Everything else looks like crap compared to ALOR. So i don't mean to respond for him yet again but I can only assume that the capsules are still a WIP and he will work on them when he gets a chance. Right now I hope he is busy finishing up KONQUEST and after a break I assume and hope he will pick up working on the capsules again. Because they look basically done they just need IVAs. At least one of them looks basically done. I mean with all of the mods he is making besides a rocket mod like KW and some plugins you wont need much else once he finishes up all his planned projects.
Is there a contact notification in the GPWS?

I'm having some fairly serious lag in the IVA with this mod, which seems fairly odd to me. I've played around with the graphics settings plenty and it has no impact on my FPS. My computer is 3.5ghz i7, a GTX 760 w/ 4gb of VRAM and 16gb of RAM. Performance shouldn't be an issue at all. Now I had an older computer with a i5 2.5, 4gb RAM and a GTX 250 and the mod ran FINE, I was getting ~60fps no issues. So it seems there's some sort of optimization issues going on and I'm not sure where. Are there any fixes for this currently, or does any one know a way to increase FPS using the IVA?
I seem to have fixed the issue! Using the 64 bit KSP (I hadn't upgraded yet) seems to have resolved everything.

Love it, great stuff!

Thank you!

Hello, this is a truly wonderful mod. Hoping for more, maybe a pod next! Anyway, I wanted to tweak the external vertical camera settings. I want it to be able to rotate 180 degrees, 360 if possible, and allso to be able to look around freely. I've been trying to find the JSI container which I assume controls this behavior, but to no avail. Is allowed camera rotation defined in a .dll somewhere? Thanks in advance.

Anyway, I wanted to tweak the external vertical camera settings. I want it to be able to rotate 180 degrees, 360 if possible, and allso to be able to look around freely. I've been trying to find the JSI container which I assume controls this behavior, but to no avail. Is allowed camera rotation defined in a .dll somewhere? Thanks in advance.

it already does that (well it should last i checked) just open up the cams on the left(or right) large RPM Screen and use the arrows to move it around

it already does that (well it should last i checked) just open up the cams on the left(or right) large RPM Screen and use the arrows to move it around

I am trying to place the custom camera on the little white platform on the left side of the shutter. I cannot pan adequately from that position. I'm just wondering if the tolerance can be edited in some JSI file or in the ALCOR files. I tried looking but I was unable to find the CamTransform container, which leads me to fear that it's buried in the RPM .dll somewhere. Any help is appreciated.
